intro: Cyrtandra begonioides, commonly known as the begonia-like cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, often showy flowers. The plant typically features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
